body:
@scheibelp 
Now that environments automatically have views attached to them (#11182)... how do I turn it off on an environment I already created?

To be more clear... I'm creating an environment by creating a directory in `environments/` and adding a `spack.yaml` file.  Then I use:
```
spack -e <myenv> concretize
spack -e <myenv> install
```

At that point, Spack decides to attach a view to my environment (which I don't want).  I never used `spack env create`, so I never got to tell Spack to NOT attach a view.  How does one change this setting *after* the environment is created? (and delete the corresponding view)?
title: Unwanted Views Even After `spack env create`.
